title: Question 22
prompt:
Sentences 7 and 8: Mario Lombe will present research into new avenues of profits. Mr. Lombe will outline the planned “Bradbury & Lombe Business in a Bag” kit.

Which is the most effective combination of these two sentences?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The subjects of sentences 7 and 8 are the same. Although they are worded slightly differently, Mario Lombe and Mr. Lombe refer to the same person. Both sentences also use the modal will. When combining these sentences, the subject and modal don’t need to be repeated. They can be removed from the second sentence, and the two predicates can be joined with the conjunction and. The combined sentence reads, “Mario Lombe will present research into new avenues of profits and outline the planned ‘Bradbury & Lombe Business in a Bag’ kit.”
Mario Lombe will present research into new avenues of profits and outline the planed “Bradbury & Lombe Business in a Bag” kit.
